result.execSummary:
The defendant Billiejean Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Billiejean Herman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Billiejean Herman was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Billiejean Herman not in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:34 p.m. Expungement review. Def has not paid all court obligations. Court will not grant at this time. Reserves Def's right to be heard in the future.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Billiejean Herman in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:43 p.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to cts 1 & 2, State now offers to dismiss and read in ct 2, Def will plead to ct 1, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, court costs, reserve right to expunge under 973.015 after 1 yr if successfully completes probation and pays all court obligations. Atty Roley and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Roley satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 possession of THC. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow the agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Reserve right to expunge after 1 yr if successfully completed probation and paid all court obligations.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. No credit if revoked. Postconviction rights.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court on 15CF120.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stacy J. Trzebiatowski, in court on 15CF121, Defendant Billiejean Herman in court on 15CF122.   Court calls 15CF120, 15CF121 & 15CF122 @ 3:18 pm.  Atty Roley is not present & all 3 case were set for plea & sentencing today.  Court explains history on scheduling of these 3 case. Defendants & court are frustrated.  State suggest court to have Order to show cause to explain why not in court.  Court authorize Order to Show Cause on atty & will  summons to show court why not in court & will not be found in contempt or purge.   Court will set.  Defendants will get copy of notice on order to show cause, parties don't have to appear.  Parties will get new date in mail, all parties address is current.

Court calls 15CF120, 15CF121 & 15CF122 @ 8:48 am. Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Stacy J. Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Roley.  Defendant Billiejean Herman in court with attorney Thomas Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin on all 3 cases.  15CF121 State will be dismiss ct 3 on Ms. Herman case, so need for preliminary hearing.  Court would like to go over with defendant's regarding conflict of interest having Atty Roley representing all of them.  Ms. Herman understands conflict, Mr. Trzebiatowski, understands conflict, Mrs. Trzebiatowski, understands conflict.  Court orders Atty Roley to provide a written waiver with def's signature before next hearing. All 3 parties wish to have Atty Roley represent them. 15CF122 State moves to dismiss ct 3 w/o prejudice.  Atty Roley enters Not Guilty pleas, Court will dismiss w/o prejudice, ct 3 & receives not guilty plea on ct's 1 & 2. Mr. Herman leaves the courtroom. 15CF120 & 15CF121 Continue to preliminary hearing. Daniel Bauknecht, Inv for Langlade County Sheriff's Dept., duly sworn on oath, testifies. Exh # 1 - Chain of evidence log.  Exh # 1 Admitted & received.  Defense has nothing more.  State needs to amend ct 1.  Court finds probable cause on both cases & binds over.  Recess @ 9:10 am.  Reconvene @ 9:20 am. on 15CF120 & 15CF121 Informations filed on both cases.  Atty Roley has copy of informations, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's in each case. Court withdraws informations. off the record @ 9:22 am. back on the record @ 9:29 am.  Informations filed on both cases.  Atty Roley has copy of informations, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's on each case.  Court will direct clerk to enter Not Guilty pleas to 4 ct's on both cases.  15CF122 to be set for Status on 9-21-15 @ 3:30 pm. Court verifies DOB on record & corrects.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Billiejean Herman in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:20 pm.  Atty Roley has copy of complaint, waives reading.  Court accepts waiver of reading of complaint.  State heard on bond.  Atty Roley does not object. Court orders $2500.00 Signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Invocation of Right to Counsel
